Articles.Content:
This is the official Constellation Mission Pack Discussion Thread.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

~~Eight forumers are independently building their own Constellation Mission Pack, Mad Rocket Scientist, Zucal, Chiken1880, LABHOUSE, Majorjim, DMSP, SaturnianBlue, And Yukon0009.~~  

(Quite outdated)

> 
> 
> 
> Majorjim's original mission pack: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92434-Duna-Constellation-mission-pack-Now-with-DL-link](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92434-Duna-Constellation-mission-pack-Now-with-DL-link)

And here is my progress so far:

Enjoy!

Inspired by Majorjim's Constellation mission pack: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92434-Duna-Constellation-mission-pack-Now-with-DL-link](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92434-Duna-Constellation-mission-pack-Now-with-DL-link)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-31T21:39:22Z" title="05/31/2016 09:39  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 31, 2016</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**
Hah! Thanks, MRS. Gimme a few, and I'll post my updated Orion, and maybe my SPR later.

I paid dearly for this screen, KVV actually offset the parts like this, so I had to rebuild to a bunch of fairings:

![rLenG3F.png](http://i.imgur.com/rLenG3F.png)

Question!

I see that on Majorjim's Altair lander, you can see fuel tanks, like this:

![jsc2007e113281.jpg](http://spaceflight.nasa.gov/gallery/images/exploration/lunarlander/hires/jsc2007e113281.jpg)

But other images of Altair show a housing for the fuel tanks, like this:

![DT%20oct%202010%20image.JPG](http://www.ascendworldwide.com/DT%20oct%202010%20image.JPG)

Can anyone tell me which is correct?

> 
> Question!
> I see that on Majorjim's Altair lander, you can see fuel tanks, like this:
> 
> [http://spaceflight.nasa.gov/gallery/images/exploration/lunarlander/hires/jsc2007e113281.jpg](http://spaceflight.nasa.gov/gallery/images/exploration/lunarlander/hires/jsc2007e113281.jpg)
> 
> But other images of Altair show a housing for the fuel tanks, like this:
> 
> [http://www.ascendworldwide.com/DT%20oct%202010%20image.JPG](http://www.ascendworldwide.com/DT%20oct%202010%20image.JPG)
> 
> Can anyone tell me which is correct?

As this has never flown, both are 'correct'. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Is that Ares 1?

> 
> Can anyone tell me which is correct?

I think both are. Altair never got beyond renders and mockups, so do whichever way you want.

> 
> Is that Ares 1?

It should be!

> 
> As this has never flown, both are 'correct'. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Alright, tanks are fun, I'll do that.

> 
> Is that Ares 1?

Yep!

> 
> I think both are. Altair never got beyond renders and mockups, so do whichever way you want.
> It should be!

See above.

How are you going to do crew capacity for the altair?

Now a leaked picture:

![XkSbrzk.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/XkSbrzk.png?1)

Mine WIP:

(yes can't make it stop looking like MJ's constell mission)

(slightly old pics)

[![screenshot460_zpsdr4t0ce1.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot460_zpsdr4t0ce1.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot460_zpsdr4t0ce1.png.html)

> (yes can't make it stop looking like MJ's constell mission)

>

>

I can't help it either! Here's my almost complete rip-off of Majorjim's Altair:

![3bcZUhg.png](http://i.imgur.com/3bcZUhg.png)

Orion took a bit longer than I thought, one of the parts started krakening. (I think krakening should be a verb.)

I'll edit this post with pics soon.
Finally, a thread for this! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I can't help it either! Here's my almost complete rip-off of Majorjim's Altair:
> [http://i.imgur.com/3bcZUhg.png](http://i.imgur.com/3bcZUhg.png)

I don't mind things looking similar, imitation is the sincerest form of flattery after all. I would prefer peeps not to just copy what I did. I want to see new imaginative designs from you guys!

Taking a different approach on the Altair.

[![screenshot3286_zpseqioy8vn.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot3286_zpseqioy8vn.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot3286_zpseqioy8vn.png.html)

> 
> Taking a different approach on the Altair.
> http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot3286_zpseqioy8vn.png.html[http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot3286_zpseqioy8vn.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot3286_zpseqioy8vn.png)

Looking good Yukon! I like the idea of using the tank for the ascent pod.

Alright, sorry for the delays, I was rewatching the new Mad Max. Awesome movie, if you ask me.

New Orion:

![3lbdMub.png](http://i.imgur.com/3lbdMub.png)

![0ILwDR9.png](http://i.imgur.com/0ILwDR9.png)

![jPzcmcs.png](http://i.imgur.com/jPzcmcs.png)

I think it emulates the shape pretty well. Here's the slapdash Orion I made for my SLS a few weeks ago, pretty bad. Glad I redid it.

![kV68TXF.png](http://i.imgur.com/kV68TXF.png)

- - - Updated - - -

Also, Yukon, your lander fairing seems tiny, especially in proportion to your MTV. What mini delightful payload is hidden in there?

Actually, the fairing is built around a 3.75m decopoler, so I should be able to fit a well designed lander in there.

Also, is noone doing a proper 4-6 man orion? Or is there a hidden command pod or two inside the MK1-2?

If you ask me, you're all better off waiting for ksp unity 5 release with 64 bits support except if you don't mind lag

> 
> imitation is the sincerest form of flattery after all.

Flattery: "excessive and insincere praise, especially that given to further one's own interests."

mkay

Pfft, who needs unity 5, I say we barge on Jeb style

In all seriousness though, I really couldn't care as I regularly keep craft under 500 parts and I have a decent computer, wouldn't know about the others though.

> 
> Alright, sorry for the delays, I was rewatching the new Mad Max. Awesome movie, if you ask me.
> New Orion:
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/3lbdMub.png](http://i.imgur.com/3lbdMub.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/0ILwDR9.png](http://i.imgur.com/0ILwDR9.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/jPzcmcs.png](http://i.imgur.com/jPzcmcs.png)
> 
> I think it emulates the shape pretty well. Here's the slapdash Orion I made for my SLS a few weeks ago, pretty bad. Glad I redid it.
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/kV68TXF.png](http://i.imgur.com/kV68TXF.png)
> 
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> Also, Yukon, your lander fairing seems tiny, especially in proportion to your MTV. What mini delightful payload is hidden in there?

Looking good man!, mine is very similar to that, good choice of parts.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> If you ask me, you're all better off waiting for ksp unity 5 release with 64 bits support except if you don't mind lag
> Flattery: "excessive and insincere praise, especially that given to further one's own interests."
> 
> mkay

Yup, your attempts aside, my point still stands. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Pfft, who needs unity 5, I say we barge on Jeb style
> In all seriousness though, I really couldn't care as I regularly keep craft under 500 parts and I have a decent computer, wouldn't know about the others though.

Yeah I will still fly this mission. Unity 5 will just make it that much more enjoyable. (hopefully).

> 
> Yup, your attempts aside, my point still stands. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I don't know what you're implying with that, but to clarify what I meant, "inspiration" isn't "imitation" and "praise" isn't "flattery".

Here on this thread you're all making the same craft, that's no wonder why it looks very similar ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) it doesn't mean they all copy you.

And on a side note if only the lander is already 400 parts then the whole craft is gonna be incredibly unpractical.

So just think about putting part efficiency in the equation.

Lol, I just finally found this.

I have a good idea for the habitation, but I think I might want to wait for Unity 5.

I have a slow and laggy mac.

DMSP out.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, my Orion is complete.

Photos as soon as I can get Imgur working.

- - - Updated - - -

I also found a bunch of Constellation Animations/Videos.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/k1Dt4YvQwTM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gHRrQlE_x3E?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

- - - Updated - - -

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0n0q_Q7Em3k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Sorry to spam you guys with videos...

- - - Updated - - -

And our favorite:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uUBhn3_P3hU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Funnily enogh, those were the very videos that got me into a bit of Orbiter and a lot of poking around later KSP. Not to rain on your parade though.

> 
> I don't know what you're implying with that, but to clarify what I meant, "inspiration" isn't "imitation" and "praise" isn't "flattery".
> Here on this thread you're all making the same craft, that's no wonder why it looks very similar ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) it doesn't mean they all copy you.
> 
> And on a side note if only the lander is already 400 parts then the whole craft is gonna be incredibly unpractical.
> 
> So just think about putting part efficiency in the equation.

If you read the previous posts you will see that two guys said that theirs where looking like my craft. And one said theirs was a copy of mine. 

 That's why I said I don't min things looking similar but would prefer that people don't just directly copy what I made. In the spirit of creativity. 

And in regards to part count I have said before that I didn't want to compromise this time. Yes the landers are over 400 parts each but that was fine in 0.90. Performance will improve. And it's not possible to have this level of detail and low part count. 

Thanks for commenting. 

MJ

> 
> And in regards to part count I have said before that I didn't want to compromise this time. Yes the landers are over 400 parts each but that was fine in 0.90. Performance will improve. And it's not possible to have this level of detail and low part count. 
> 
> Thanks for commenting. 
> 
> MJ

And that is why I did the simpler Altair version.

Oh and no pics yet, but 6 man Orion is buildt.
